derivation: a primitive particle (rather from the relative pronoun, H834 (אֲשֶׁר));
outline:
1. there, thither
    1. there
    2. thither (after verbs of motion)
    3. from there, thence
    4. then (as an adverb of time)
kjv_def: in it, [phrase] thence, there (-in, [phrase] of, [phrase] out), [phrase] thither, [phrase] whither.
strongs_def: there (transferring to time) then; often thither, or thence
